name: DeBolt et al. v. Baldwin Township et al., Appellants

judges: Before MaXey, C. J., Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
parties: DeBolt et al. v. Baldwin Township et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The appeal is dismissed. As the order in Whitehall Borough Incorporation Case, 358 Pa. 90, has been af-fimed in an opinion this day filed, the question involved in the present appeal has become moot.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: J ohri A. Metz, Jr., with him Irwin I. Try on and Metz é Metz, for appellants.
Robert A. Rundle, with him John E. Evans, Jr., and Edward R. Lawrence, for appellees.'
casebody.head_matter:
DeBolt et al. v. Baldwin Township et al., Appellants.
Argued November 10, 1947.
Before MaXey, C. J., Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
reargument refused January 5, 1948.
J ohri A. Metz, Jr., with him Irwin I. Try on and Metz é Metz, for appellants.
Robert A. Rundle, with him John E. Evans, Jr., and Edward R. Lawrence, for appellees.'
November 24, 1947:
